definition: to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)

sentences.english: Throughout history empires have waxed and waned .
sentences.chinese: 历史上各个帝国革故鼎新均有兴衰。

sentences.english: The Chinese civilization has always given prominence to unremitting self-improvement, reform and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 中华文明历来注重自强不息，不断革故鼎新。

sentences.english: Finally, here, I wish countries to reforming the past.
sentences.chinese: 最后，在这里，我祝各国能够革故鼎新。

definition: to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
everyone participates in reforms (idiom)/to replace the old with new/to reform and start afresh
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
to destroy the old and establish the new (idiom)/radical transformation
whetstone/(fig.) to hone/to temper/to encourage
to promote what is useful and get rid of what is harmful (idiom)
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
to turn over a new leaf
to transform/to change
